definitions.definition: To take possession of as a right (especially in Biblical translations).
definitions.example: Your descendants will inherit the earth.

definitions.definition: To receive (property, a title, etc.), by legal succession or bequest after the previous owner's death.
definitions.example: After Grandad died, I inherited the house.

definitions.definition: To receive a characteristic from one's ancestors by genetic transmission.
definitions.example: Let's hope the baby inherits his mother's looks and his father's intelligence.

definitions.definition: To derive from people or conditions previously in force.
definitions.example: This country has inherited an invidious class culture.
Lucky old Daniel – his grandfather died rich, and he's inherited.

definitions.definition: To derive (existing functionality) from a superclass.
definitions.example: ModalWindow inherits all the properties and methods of Window.

definitions.definition: To derive a new class from (a superclass).
